017package org.parboiled;
018
019import org.parboiled.buffers.InputBuffer;
020import org.parboiled.common.ImmutableLinkedList;
021import org.parboiled.common.StringUtils;
022import org.parboiled.errors.BasicParseError;
023import org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException;
024import org.parboiled.errors.ParseError;
025import org.parboiled.errors.ParserRuntimeException;
026import org.parboiled.matchers.*;
027import org.parboiled.parserunners.RecoveringParseRunner;
028import org.parboiled.support.*;
029
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.Set;
032import java.util.HashSet;
033
034import static org.parboiled.errors.ErrorUtils.printParseError;
035import static org.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
036import static org.parboiled.matchers.MatcherUtils.unwrap;
037
038/**
039 * <p>The Context implementation orchestrating most of the matching process.</p>
040 * <p>The parsing process works as following:
041 * After the rule tree (which is in fact a directed and potentially even cyclic graph of {@link Matcher} instances)
042 * has been created a root MatcherContext is instantiated for the root rule (Matcher).
043 * A subsequent call to {@link #runMatcher()} starts the parsing process.</p>
044 * <p>The MatcherContext delegates to a given {@link MatchHandler} to call {@link Matcher#match(MatcherContext)},
045 * passing itself to the Matcher which executes its logic, potentially calling sub matchers.
046 * For each sub matcher the matcher creates/initializes a subcontext with {@link Matcher#getSubContext(MatcherContext)}
047 * and then calls {@link #runMatcher()} on it.</p>
048 * <p>This basically creates a stack of MatcherContexts, each corresponding to their rule matchers. The MatcherContext
049 * instances serve as companion objects to the matchers, providing them with support for building the
050 * parse tree nodes, keeping track of input locations and error recovery.</p>
051 * <p>At each point during the parsing process the matchers and action expressions have access to the current
052 * MatcherContext and all "open" parent MatcherContexts through the {@link #getParent()} chain.</p>
053 * <p>For performance reasons subcontext instances are reused instead of being recreated. If a MatcherContext instance
054 * returns null on a {@link #getMatcher()} call it has been retired (is invalid) and is waiting to be reinitialized
055 * with a new Matcher by its parent</p>
056 */
057public class MatcherContext<V> implements Context<V> {
058
059    private final InputBuffer inputBuffer;
060    private final ValueStack<V> valueStack;
061    private final List<ParseError> parseErrors;
062    private final MatchHandler matchHandler;
063    private final MatcherContext<V> parent;
064    private final int level;
065    private final boolean fastStringMatching;
066    private final Set<MatcherPosition> memoizedMismatches;
067
068    private MatcherContext<V> subContext;
069    private int startIndex;
070    private int currentIndex;
071    private char currentChar;
072    private Matcher matcher;
073    private Node<V> node;
074    private ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>> subNodes = ImmutableLinkedList.nil();
075    private MatcherPath path;
076    private int intTag;
077    private boolean hasError;
078    private boolean nodeSuppressed;
079    private boolean inErrorRecovery;
080
081    /**
082     * Initializes a new root MatcherContext.
083     *
084     * @param inputBuffer        the InputBuffer for the parsing run
085     * @param valueStack         the ValueStack instance to use for the parsing run
086     * @param parseErrors        the parse error list to create ParseError objects in
087     * @param matchHandler       the MatcherHandler to use for the parsing run
088     * @param matcher            the root matcher
089     * @param fastStringMatching <p>Fast string matching "short-circuits" the default practice of treating string rules
090     *                           as simple Sequence of character rules. When fast string matching is enabled strings are
091     *                           matched at once, without relying on inner CharacterMatchers. Even though this can lead
092     *                           to significant increases of parsing performance it does not play well with error
093     *                           reporting and recovery, which relies on character level matches.
094     *                           Therefore the {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner} and {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.RecoveringParseRunner}
095     *                           implementations only enable fast string matching during their basic first parsing run
096     *                           and disable it once the input has proven to contain errors.</p>
097     */
098    public MatcherContext(InputBuffer inputBuffer, ValueStack<V> valueStack, List<ParseError> parseErrors,
099                          MatchHandler matchHandler, Matcher matcher, boolean fastStringMatching) {
100        this(checkArgNotNull(inputBuffer, "inputBuffer"), checkArgNotNull(valueStack, "valueStack"),
101                checkArgNotNull(parseErrors, "parseErrors"), checkArgNotNull(matchHandler, "matchHandler"),
102                null, 0, fastStringMatching,  new HashSet<MatcherPosition>());
103        this.currentChar = inputBuffer.charAt(0);
104        this.matcher = ProxyMatcher.unwrap(checkArgNotNull(matcher, "matcher"));
105        this.nodeSuppressed = matcher.isNodeSuppressed();
106    }
107
108    private MatcherContext(InputBuffer inputBuffer, ValueStack<V> valueStack, List<ParseError> parseErrors,
109                           MatchHandler matchHandler, MatcherContext<V> parent, int level, boolean fastStringMatching,
110                           Set<MatcherPosition> memoizedMismatches) {
111        this.inputBuffer = inputBuffer;
112        this.valueStack = valueStack;
113        this.parseErrors = parseErrors;
114        this.matchHandler = matchHandler;
115        this.parent = parent;
116        this.level = level;
117        this.fastStringMatching = fastStringMatching;
118        this.memoizedMismatches = memoizedMismatches;
119    }
120
121    @Override
122    public String toString() {
123        return getPath().toString();
124    }
125
126    //////////////////////////////// CONTEXT INTERFACE ////////////////////////////////////
127
128    public MatcherContext<V> getParent() {
129        return parent;
130    }
131
132    public InputBuffer getInputBuffer() {
133        return inputBuffer;
134    }
135
136    public int getStartIndex() {
137        return startIndex;
138    }
139
140    public Matcher getMatcher() {
141        return matcher;
142    }
143
144    public char getCurrentChar() {
145        return currentChar;
146    }
147
148    public List<ParseError> getParseErrors() {
149        return parseErrors;
150    }
151
152    public int getCurrentIndex() {
153        return currentIndex;
154    }
155
156    public MatcherPath getPath() {
157        if (path == null) {
158            path = new MatcherPath(new MatcherPath.Element(matcher, startIndex, level),
159                    parent != null ? parent.getPath() : null);
160        }
161        return path;
162    }
163
164    public int getLevel() {
165        return level;
166    }
167
168    public boolean fastStringMatching() {
169        return fastStringMatching;
170    }
171
172    public ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>> getSubNodes() {
173        return matcher.isNodeSkipped() ? subNodes : getSubNodes(subNodes, ImmutableLinkedList.<Node<V>>nil());
174    }
175
176    private static <V> ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>> getSubNodes(ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>> remaining,
177                                                                ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>> tail) {
178        while (!remaining.isEmpty()) {
179            Node<V> head = remaining.head();
180            if (head.getMatcher().isNodeSkipped()) {
181                tail = getSubNodes(((ImmutableLinkedList<Node<V>>)head.getChildren()), tail);
182            } else {
183                tail = tail.prepend(head);
184            }
185            remaining = remaining.tail();
186        }
187        return tail;
188    }
189
190    public boolean inPredicate() {
191        return matcher instanceof TestMatcher || matcher instanceof TestNotMatcher ||
192                parent != null && parent.inPredicate();
193    }
194
195    public boolean inErrorRecovery() {
196        return inErrorRecovery;
197    }
198    
199    public boolean isNodeSuppressed() {
200        return nodeSuppressed;
201    }
202
203    public boolean hasError() {
204        return hasError;
205    }
206
207    public String getMatch() {
208        checkActionContext();
209        MatcherContext prevContext = subContext;
210        if (hasError) {
211            Node prevNode = prevContext.node;
212            return prevNode != null ? ParseTreeUtils.getNodeText(prevNode, inputBuffer) : "";
213        }
214        return inputBuffer.extract(prevContext.startIndex, prevContext.currentIndex);
215    }
216
217    public char getFirstMatchChar() {
218        checkActionContext();
219        int ix = subContext.startIndex;
220        if (subContext.currentIndex <= ix) {
221            throw new GrammarException("getFirstMatchChar called but previous rule did not match anything");
222        }
223        return inputBuffer.charAt(ix);
224    }
225
226    public int getMatchStartIndex() {
227        checkActionContext();
228        return subContext.startIndex;
229    }
230
231    public int getMatchEndIndex() {
232        checkActionContext();
233        return subContext.currentIndex;
234    }
235
236    public int getMatchLength() {
237        checkActionContext();
238        return subContext.currentIndex - subContext.getStartIndex();
239    }
240
241    public Position getPosition() {
242        return inputBuffer.getPosition(currentIndex);
243    }
244
245    public IndexRange getMatchRange() {
246        checkActionContext();
247        return new IndexRange(subContext.startIndex, subContext.currentIndex);
248    }
249
250    private void checkActionContext() {
251        // make sure all the constraints are met
252        Checks.ensure(unwrap(matcher) instanceof SequenceMatcher && intTag > 0 &&
253                subContext.matcher instanceof ActionMatcher,
254                "Illegal call to getMatch(), getMatchStartIndex(), getMatchEndIndex() or getMatchRange(), " +
255                        "only valid in Sequence rule actions that are not in first position");
256    }
257
258    public ValueStack<V> getValueStack() {
259        return valueStack;
260    }
261
262    //////////////////////////////// PUBLIC ////////////////////////////////////
263
264    public void setMatcher(Matcher matcher) {
265        this.matcher = matcher;
266    }
267
268    public void setStartIndex(int startIndex) {
269        checkArgument(startIndex >= 0);
270        this.startIndex = startIndex;
271    }
272
273    public void setCurrentIndex(int currentIndex) {
274        checkArgument(currentIndex >= 0);
275        this.currentIndex = currentIndex;
276        currentChar = inputBuffer.charAt(currentIndex);
277    }
278    
279    public void setInErrorRecovery(boolean flag) {
280        inErrorRecovery = flag;
281    }
282
283    public void advanceIndex(int delta) {
284        currentIndex += delta;
285        currentChar = inputBuffer.charAt(currentIndex);
286    }
287
288    public Node<V> getNode() {
289        return node;
290    }
291
292    public int getIntTag() {
293        return intTag;
294    }
295
296    public void setIntTag(int intTag) {
297        this.intTag = intTag;
298    }
299
300    public void markError() {
301        if (!hasError) {
302            hasError = true;
303            if (parent != null) parent.markError();
304        }
305    }
306
307    public Boolean hasMismatched() {
308        return memoizedMismatches.contains(MatcherPosition.at(matcher, currentIndex));
309    }
310
311    public void memoizeMismatch() {
312        memoizedMismatches.add(MatcherPosition.at(matcher, currentIndex));
313    }
314
315    @SuppressWarnings({"ConstantConditions"})
316    public void createNode() {
317        if (!nodeSuppressed) {
318            node = new NodeImpl<V>(matcher, getSubNodes(), startIndex, currentIndex,
319                    valueStack.isEmpty() ? null : valueStack.peek(), hasError);
320            if (parent != null) {
321                parent.subNodes = parent.subNodes.prepend(node);
322            }
323        }
324    }
325
326    public final MatcherContext<V> getBasicSubContext() {
327        if (subContext == null) {
328            // init new level
329            subContext = new MatcherContext<V>(inputBuffer, valueStack, parseErrors, matchHandler, this, level + 1,
330                        fastStringMatching, memoizedMismatches);
331        } else {
332            subContext.path = null; // we always need to reset the MatcherPath, even for actions
333        }
334        return subContext;
335    }
336
337    public final MatcherContext<V> getSubContext(Matcher matcher) {
338        MatcherContext<V> sc = getBasicSubContext();
339        sc.matcher = matcher;
340        sc.startIndex = sc.currentIndex = currentIndex;
341        sc.currentChar = currentChar;
342        sc.node = null;
343        sc.subNodes = ImmutableLinkedList.nil();
344        sc.nodeSuppressed = nodeSuppressed || this.matcher.areSubnodesSuppressed() || matcher.isNodeSuppressed();
345        sc.hasError = false;
346        return sc;
347    }
348
349    public boolean runMatcher() {
350        try {
351            if (matchHandler.match(this)) {
352                if (parent != null) {
353                    parent.currentIndex = currentIndex;
354                    parent.currentChar = currentChar;
355                }
356                matcher = null; // "retire" this context
357                return true;
358            }
359            matcher = null; // "retire" this context until is "activated" again by a getSubContext(...) on the parent
360            return false;
361        } catch (ParserRuntimeException e) {
362            throw e; // don't wrap, just bubble up
363        } catch (RecoveringParseRunner.TimeoutException e) {
364            throw e; // don't wrap, just bubble up
365        } catch (Throwable e) {
366            throw new ParserRuntimeException(e,
367                    printParseError(new BasicParseError(inputBuffer, currentIndex,
368                            StringUtils.escape(String.format("Error while parsing %s '%s' at input position",
369                                    matcher instanceof ActionMatcher ? "action" : "rule", getPath())))) + '\n' + e);
370        }
371    }
372}
